title: This is why Riot is a great company
body: My family lost everything we owned in a house fire two weeks ago. Today, I checked the mail and found a care package from Hollymonster and Riot Games. Talk about above and beyond!

replies.body: Hope everything's going okay! ^__^

> Hope everything's going okay! ^__^

we are gonna be fine... it's a struggle right now, but I'm sure down the road, when we look back, it'll just look like a speed bump
It was K
A company is made up of people, Reds are good people.

> A company is made up of people, Reds are good people.

apparently, they are REALLY good people. in an age of companies placing emphasis on money over customer needs (my cable company charged me $600 to replace their lost equipment), it's so refreshing to see that my family matters to at least one company.

Not at all accusing you of being fraudulent, but how did you manage to recover your computer and stuff? Or did the fire get handled before it spread to where they were and you got them after? I had a garage fire a few years back and not only did it destroy almost everything, but the fire department/police wouldn't even let us in the house until they declared it totally dealt with hours after we called them.

p.s. hope the emergency services bills aren't too bad, and that your insurance behaves appropriately. p.p.s. don't let your family sit on the insurance without taking action, my garage still isn't rebuilt and the insurance company is starting to threaten expiration of the coverage.

> Not at all accusing you of being fraudulent, but how did you manage to recover your computer and stuff? Or did the fire get handled before it spread to where they were and you got them after? I had a garage fire a few years back and not only did it destroy almost everything, but the fire department/police wouldn't even let us in the house until they declared it totally dealt with hours after we called them.

We actually lost everything including a vehicle. I seriously made it out in shorts and crocs (I'm not proud of that). The computer in the picture is a loaner from a League of Legends community organization in Oklahoma called United As [ONE]. The head of that group is actually the guy that reached to to Riot unbeknownst to me.

Downvotes from people who didn't believe I was being genuine. :\ 

Meanwhile here I am thinking that this is even cooler - the community *and* Riot reaching out for you. Anyway glad your family is all safe and hope the recovery is as painless as possible. Good luck. :)
Sorry for your loss. I'm glad Riot was able to help brighten your day!
Sorry to hear about your unfortunate loss.. That is an outstanding gesture on behalf of Riot.. Bravo!

Would it appear inapropriate if I where to say I would gladly have my house burnt for those oranges? Idk they just seem like the most perfect thing one could possess. I feel like looking at it daily alone could fix alot of my recent anxiety

Anyway it looks like the perfect present

> Would it appear inapropriate if I where to say I would gladly have my house burnt for those oranges? Idk they just seem like the most perfect thing one could possess. I feel like looking at it daily alone could fix alot of my recent anxiety
> 
> Anyway it looks like the perfect present

add me in game "Steve The Pale" and get your address to me. I'll gladly ship one your way.

Im from EUNE so I imagine it would be quite complicated. Anyway, you should keep them. You need them more than me atm.

Best of luck. Boards are always here to support you

TBH yes it would. I am happy that Steve The Pale is fine with this comment, but having your house burnt down is a very tragic incident. Think about how much you would need to replace... EVERYTHING! I advise you to rethink your comment.

Im familiar with tragic incidents and using them as a joke when I talk to people is pretty much my defense mechanism. When I struggle with something bad, people always treat me as if I was made of fragile glass and I tell you, this kind of forced empathy usually iritates me. But well it might be just me. Im happy that OP didnt take my words for making fun of his loss as well.
So effin cool. I got teary eyed. GG riot :)

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kOW5QgVo834/UbIoLTixRaI/AAAAAAAAAHk/Hio6dWVNl-E/s400/the+feels.jpg

That's just awesome... ^.^

Oh my god how can a company get so good? I mean you are not even a community celebrity, just a random guy who clearly had a family tragedy and they put effort into giving you  and your family help like these. I hope you will be able to get things back to normal soon. I think I'm going to marry League of Legends someday...xD

As someone who has had a string of bad news in the past week, this brings a tear to my eye. So happy to see people looking out for one another. Bless you and our family, and in the wise words of Lux, stay positive.
That's certainly a way to make someone's day. Excellent work Riot Hollymonster
Good guy, Rito!

Right?
For sure!
I'm especially proud for riot that it was a handwritten note, typed letters can seem so impersonal sometimes, even though the gesture is incredible by itself. WP Riot.
yeah it was definitely a nice touch
